area_name: Great Leaders of the World Wall

content.description: Start about 100 yards right of Kublai Khan and around the corner at a steep, smooth wall with a thin crack running up it. Climb the right facing corner to a roof, then move around left to the smooth face. Climb the face along a thin crack (bolt, Tricams) to a ledge. Up the steep left facing corner above to the top. Bolt placed on the lead from a hook.
content.protection: One bolt, Tricams, standard gear. Rappel with two ropes.
content.location: Start about 100 yards right of Kublai Khan and around the corner at a steep, smooth wall with a thin crack running up it.

content.description: Start about 150 feet left of Kublai Khan behind a huge block. Climb up behind the block, then up a small pillar to a ledge. Move left and up the face (crux) to a notch on the left.Mel Thompson was the governor of New Hampshire from 1970-78. Among other things, he wanted to arm the NH National Guard with nuclear weapons!
content.protection: Not much pro. Walk off left (toward Fremont Saddle) or rappel from the top of another route.
content.location: Start about 150 feet left of Kublai Khan behind a huge block.

content.description:
This route climbs a very impressive roof crack that Mr. Waugh led onsight. The roof crack is pretty obvious once you get up to the base of the cliff. Start below the right edge of a huge roof that is about 60 feet above the ground. 

  P1: Climb the face just right of a wide crack to a ledge. Move left, then up to another ledge with a bolt (80 feet; 5.5). 

  P2: Move left under the roof and climb the crack out the roof and up the face above until it ends. Continue up the steep wall above to the top using pockets (5.12a/b).
content.protection: Carry a good selection of gear up to a blue Camalot.

content.description: This route climbs the arete to the right of the Kublai Khan roof crack and left of a smooth pocketed face. Start as for Kublai Khan below the right edge of a roof 60 feet up.P1: Climb the face just right of a wide crack to a ledge. Move left then up to another ledge (bolt, belay for Kublai Khan). Continue up the corner to a ledge below a smooth, pocketed face and a bolt belay (80 feet; 5.5)P2: Climb the right arete of the smooth pocketed wall past one bolt and numerous small Tricam placements (60 feet; 5.9-).
content.protection: One bolt and numerous small Tricam placements protect the crux pitch.
content.location: This route climbs the arete to the right of the Kublai Khan roof crack and left of a smooth pocketed face. Start as for Kublai Khan below the right edge of a roof 60 feet up.

content.description: This route is located about 60 feet to the right of Kublai Khan. It starts on a ledge up above the ground and is probably best approached via the Evan Mecham Route (5.5). P1: Climb the Evan Mecham Route to a ledge. Move right to a thin seam and belay (5.5)P2: Climb a thin seam to an anchor atop the route (5.10b/c).
content.protection: A 90 foot rappel from the top of the route will get you to the starting ledge.
content.location: This route is located about 60 feet to the right of Kublai Khan. It starts on a ledge up above the ground and is probably best approached via the Evan Mecham Route (5.5).

content.description: Start as for Kublai Khan below the right edge of a huge roof about 60 feet up.P1: Climb the face just right of a wide crack to a ledge. Move left, then up to another ledge (bolt; belay for Kublai Khan). Continue up the corner to a ledge with an anchor below a smooth, pocketed face.P2: Climb the center of the smooth, pocketed face left of Huri Andropoff past two bolts (5.9-).Bolts placed on lead from hooks.
content.protection: Two bolts and Tricams protect the crux pitch. Rappel from an anchor on top of the cliff.
content.location: Start as for Kublai Khan below the right edge of a huge roof about 60 feet up.

content.description: Start about 30 feet right of Kublai Khan below a water polished a chimney. Climb the waterchute/chimney to the top. At about 20 feet up, you can move right through a cave to access the start of Hannibal and His Elephants.As the 17th governor of Arizona, Mecham was plagued by controversy and became the first U.S. governor to simultaneously face removal from office through impeachment, a scheduled recall election, and a felony indictment. He was the first Arizona governor to be impeached.
content.protection: Standard rack. Rappel from the top of any of the adjacent routes.
content.location: Start about 30 feet right of Kublai Khan at a waterchute/chimney.

content.description: Start 100 feet right of Kublai Khan below a dirty, left-facing corner.P1: Climb a dirty left facing corner to gain the right end of the ledge that Hannibal and His Elephants starts on or climb the first portion of the Evan Mecham Route (5.5).P2: From the right end of the ledge, follow a faint seam past two bolts to a scoop/alcove. Climb out of the scoop (crux) to the top (5.10+).Bolts placed on the lead.
content.protection: Two bolts and some gear protect the route. Rappel from the anchor atop the route.
content.location: Start 100 feet right of Kublai Khan below a left-facing corner that leads to a ledge.

content.description: Start as for Kublai Khan below the right edge of a huge roof that is about 60 feet up.P1: Climb the face just right of a wide crack to a ledge. Move left, then up to another ledge with a bolt (80 feet; 5.5).P2: From the belay on Kublai Khan, climb up the smooth, pocketed face then up the left side of the face past three bolts (5.9).Bolts placed on the lead from hooks.
content.protection: Three bolts and Tricams protect the route. Rappel from anchors.
content.location: This route climbs the center of the smooth, pocketed face to the right of the Kublai Khan roof crack.

content.description: Start on the ledge just to the left of Hannibal and His Elephants. This ledge is to the right of Kublai Khan.P1: Either climb the Evan Mecham Route and move right to gain the ledge (5.5) or climb a dirty, left facing corner that leads to the right end of the ledge, then move left.P2: Start just left of Hannibal and His Elephants at a faint seam. Follow the seam past two bolts to the top (5.9+). Bolts placed on the lead.
content.protection: Two bolts, Tricams, other gear. Rappel from a rappel anchor on top.
content.location: Start on the ledge just to the left of Hannibal and His Elephants. This ledge is to the right of Kublai Khan.

pathTokens: Great Leaders of the World Wall

content.description: This crag is generally one pitch in height. To the right of the crag is a free-standing spire (T-Rex) with at least one route on it. The cliff is generally sunny.
